channel.title: Wtf
channel.description:
I can't access general discussion, it just sends me back to the front page.
I am using chrome, and i have no problems when trying to access the general discussion from work (also whit chrome).
what can be causing this? it works in IE..
EDIT: I dont have this problem whit any of the other sections
EDIT2: if i use a proxy i can access it...

item.title: Wtf
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Hmm. I wonder if two windows before tabbed browsing used different caches and cookies though? I don’t know of a way to check, via code anyways, but if I can find a computer that runs IE6 it should be possible to check by opening two windows and setting a cookie in one and checking if it is set in the other. (this website’s TOS would be an easy way)

Read full topic

item.title: Wtf
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

well, in the same way that opening more than one window did before tabbed browsing i guess

Read full topic

item.title: Wtf
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Ok, that would still have nasty synchronization issues too though.

Read full topic

item.title: Wtf
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

They’re not really sandboxes, just another process - IE8 does the same thing

Read full topic

item.title: Wtf
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I just have a feeling it has to do with the ‘feature’ unique to chrome. Each tab runs in it’s own ‘sandbox’. Which is great because one website can’t crash your entire browser, but I imagine it is also a nightmare for developers, synchronizing all of the data, such as the cache and cookies, between all of these different instances. There is bound to be conflicts in the cache and cookie data, and trying to resolve them smartly would be a nightmare. This is the second or third ‘strange problem’ I have heard in regard to chrome and behavior that could be the result of these synchronization conflicts.

Read full topic

ive had this problem with the “newest topics” thing before, but im running the dev branch of chromium on that machine so i shrugged it off

item.title: Wtf

@moparisthebest wrote:

It is definitely odd. Chrome could have just messed up I guess and cached something it shouldn’t have.

item.title: Wtf
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:312331”][quote author=sppt link=topic=408738.msg3019115#msg3019115 date=1257461951]

Strange…

I assume no one else has this problem? It could be something like spyware causing it.

Or it’s just the forum not sending the header to stop the browser from caching.
[/quote]

The forum does send that header. And if that was the case he would have it with all the other boards too.[/quote]
Yeah but clearing the cache helped, so it strikes me as odd.

Read full topic
